drug_interactions.description: Increased bleeding risk due to anticoagulant and antiplatelet effects
drug_interactions.mechanism: Warfarin inhibits vitamin K synthesis, aspirin inhibits platelet aggregation
drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid combination. If necessary, monitor INR closely and watch for bleeding signs
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Multiple studies show 2-3x increased bleeding risk

drug_interactions.description: Reduced ACE inhibitor effectiveness and increased kidney damage risk
drug_interactions.mechanism: NSAIDs can reduce ACE inhibitor antihypertensive effects and cause kidney toxicity
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor blood pressure and kidney function if used together
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Studies show 10-15% reduction in antihypertensive effect

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of lactic acidosis
drug_interactions.mechanism: Alcohol can impair lactate metabolism while metformin increases lactate production
drug_interactions.recommendation: Limit alcohol consumption, especially with kidney or liver problems
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Case reports of lactic acidosis with heavy alcohol use

drug_interactions.description: Dramatically increased statin levels leading to muscle toxicity risk
drug_interactions.mechanism: Grapefruit inhibits CYP3A4 enzyme that metabolizes simvastatin
drug_interactions.recommendation: Avoid grapefruit juice completely while taking simvastatin
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Can increase simvastatin levels by 7-16 fold

drug_interactions.description: Increased digoxin toxicity risk due to potassium depletion
drug_interactions.mechanism: Furosemide causes potassium loss, low potassium increases digoxin toxicity
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor potassium levels and digoxin blood levels regularly
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Hypokalemia increases digoxin binding to cardiac receptors

drug_interactions.description: Increased lithium levels leading to toxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Thiazide diuretics reduce lithium clearance by the kidneys
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor lithium levels closely, may need dose reduction

drug_interactions.description: Increased phenytoin levels causing toxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Fluconazole inhibits CYP2C9 enzyme that metabolizes phenytoin
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor phenytoin levels, reduce dose if necessary

drug_interactions.description: Increased theophylline levels causing toxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Ciprofloxacin inhibits CYP1A2 enzyme that metabolizes theophylline
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor theophylline levels, reduce dose by 30-50%

drug_interactions.description: Increased cyclosporine levels leading to nephrotoxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Ketoconazole inhibits CYP3A4 enzyme that metabolizes cyclosporine
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor cyclosporine levels closely, reduce dose
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Can increase cyclosporine levels by 3-5 fold

drug_interactions.description: Increased bleeding risk due to enhanced anticoagulation
drug_interactions.mechanism: Amiodarone inhibits warfarin metabolism and displaces protein binding
drug_interactions.recommendation: Reduce warfarin dose by 30-50%, monitor INR frequently

drug_interactions.description: Reduced contraceptive effectiveness
drug_interactions.mechanism: Carbamazepine induces CYP3A4 enzyme, increasing estrogen metabolism
drug_interactions.recommendation: Use alternative contraception methods

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of muscle toxicity (rhabdomyolysis)
drug_interactions.mechanism: Clarithromycin inhibits CYP3A4 enzyme that metabolizes atorvastatin
drug_interactions.recommendation: Temporarily discontinue statin or use azithromycin instead
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Can increase atorvastatin levels by 4-6 fold

drug_interactions.description: Severe hypotension due to additive vasodilation
drug_interactions.mechanism: Both drugs cause vasodilation through different pathways
drug_interactions.recommendation: Contraindicated - do not use together

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of serotonin syndrome
drug_interactions.mechanism: Both drugs increase serotonin levels through different mechanisms
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor for serotonin syndrome symptoms, consider alternatives

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of bradycardia and heart block
drug_interactions.mechanism: Both drugs slow heart rate through different mechanisms
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor heart rate and blood pressure closely

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of severe bone marrow toxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Allopurinol inhibits xanthine oxidase, reducing azathioprine metabolism
drug_interactions.recommendation: Reduce azathioprine dose to 25% of normal dose
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Can increase azathioprine toxicity by 3-4 fold

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of gastrointestinal bleeding and ulcers
drug_interactions.mechanism: Both drugs can cause gastric irritation and bleeding
drug_interactions.recommendation: Use gastroprotective agents, monitor for GI symptoms

drug_interactions.description: Masked hypoglycemia symptoms and prolonged hypoglycemia
drug_interactions.mechanism: Beta-blockers mask tachycardia and delay glucose recovery
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor blood glucose more frequently, patient education
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Can mask warning signs of hypoglycemia

drug_interactions.description: Reduced antiplatelet effect of clopidogrel
drug_interactions.mechanism: Omeprazole inhibits CYP2C19 enzyme needed for clopidogrel activation
drug_interactions.recommendation: Use pantoprazole instead of omeprazole if PPI needed

drug_interactions.description: Reduced absorption of levothyroxine
drug_interactions.mechanism: Calcium binds to levothyroxine in the gut, reducing absorption
drug_interactions.recommendation: Separate administration by at least 4 hours

drug_interactions.description: Reduced absorption of both medications
drug_interactions.mechanism: Iron chelates with tetracycline, forming insoluble complexes
drug_interactions.recommendation: Separate administration by at least 2 hours

drug_interactions.description: Increased digoxin levels leading to toxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Quinidine displaces digoxin from tissue binding and reduces renal clearance
drug_interactions.recommendation: Reduce digoxin dose by 50%, monitor levels closely

drug_interactions.description: Reduced contraceptive effectiveness
drug_interactions.mechanism: Rifampin strongly induces CYP3A4, increasing estrogen metabolism
drug_interactions.recommendation: Use alternative contraception methods during and after treatment

drug_interactions.description: Increased bleeding risk due to dual anticoagulation
drug_interactions.mechanism: Both drugs affect different aspects of coagulation cascade
drug_interactions.recommendation: Monitor for bleeding, use lower doses if combination necessary

drug_interactions.description: Increased risk of liver toxicity
drug_interactions.mechanism: Alcohol induces CYP2E1 enzyme, increasing toxic acetaminophen metabolites
drug_interactions.recommendation: Limit alcohol consumption, avoid chronic heavy drinking
drug_interactions.clinical_evidence: Increased hepatotoxicity with chronic alcohol use

metadata.description: Comprehensive drug-drug interaction database with clinical evidence and recommendations
